alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 10:29AM PST until December 10 at 8:37PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. Skagit River Near Concrete affecting Skagit County. Snohomish River At Snohomish affecting Snohomish County. Snohomish River Near Monroe affecting Snohomish County. Skykomish River Near Gold Bar affecting Snohomish County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skagit River Near Mt. Vernon affecting Skagit County. Snoqualmie River Near Carnation affecting King County. Snoqualmie River Near Snoqualmie Falls affecting King County. .Heavy rain is over but flood waters continue to make their way down rivers and streams. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 17.0 feet. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to flood stage late tonight and fluctuate there through Tuesday night. It will then continue to fall. Additional rises are possible there after. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 1245 PM PST.
